intro: Origanum herba-barona, commonly known as Spanish oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and have a strong, pungent aroma due to high concentrations of essential oils. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for Mediterranean gardens.
